verses.verse: And David<WH1732> fled<WH1272> from Naioth<WH5121> in Ramah,<WH7414> and came<WH935> and said<WH559> before<WH6440> Jonathan,<WH3083> What<WH4100> have I done?<WH6213> what<WH4100> is my iniquity?<WH5771> and what<WH4100> is my sin<WH2403> before<WH6440> your father,<WH1> that he seeks<WH1245> my life?<WH5315>

And he said<WH559> to him, God forbid;<WH2486> you shall not die:<WH4191> behold,<WH2009> my father<WH1> will do<WH6213> nothing<WH3808> <WH1697> either great<WH1419> or<WH176> small,<WH6996> but that he will show<WH1540> it me: and why<WH4069> should my father<WH1> hide<WH5641> this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> from me? it is not so.

Then said<WH559> Jonathan<WH3083> to David,<WH1732> Whatever<WH4100> your soul<WH5315> desires,<WH559> I will even do<WH6213> it for you.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Jonathan,<WH3083> Behold,<WH2009> to morrow<WH4279> is the new<WH2320> moon,<WH2320> and I should not fail to sit<WH3427> with the king<WH4428> at meat:<WH398> but let me go,<WH7971> that I may hide<WH5641> myself in the field<WH7704> to the third<WH7992> day at even.<WH6153>

If<WH518> your father<WH1> at all miss<WH6485> me, then say,<WH559> David<WH1732> earnestly asked<WH7592> leave of me that he might run<WH7323> to Bethlehem<WH1035> his city:<WH5892> for there is a yearly<WH3117> sacrifice<WH2077> there<WH8033> for all<WH3605> the family.<WH4940>

If<WH518> he say<WH559> thus,<WH3541> It is well;<WH2896> your servant<WH5650> shall have peace:<WH7965> but if<WH518> he be very wroth,<WH2734> then be sure<WH3045> that evil<WH7451> is determined<WH3615> by him.

Therefore you shall deal<WH6213> kindly<WH2617> with your servant;<WH5650> for you have brought<WH935> your servant<WH5650> into a covenant<WH1285> of the LORD<WH3068> with you: notwithstanding, if<WH518> there be in me iniquity,<WH5771> slay<WH4191> me yourself;<WH859> for why<WH4100> should you bring<WH935> me to your father?<WH1>

And Jonathan<WH3083> said,<WH559> Far<WH2486> be it from you: for if<WH518> I knew<WH3045> certainly that evil<WH7451> were determined<WH3615> by my father<WH1> to come<WH935> on you, then would not I tell<WH5046> it you?
Then said<WH559> David<WH1732> to Jonathan,<WH3083> Who<WH4310> shall tell<WH5046> me? or<WH176> what<WH4100> if<WH176> your father<WH1> answer<WH6030> you roughly?<WH7186>
And Jonathan<WH3083> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Come,<WH3212> and let us go<WH3318> out into the field.<WH7704> And they went<WH3318> out both<WH8147> of them into the field.<WH7704>

And Jonathan<WH3083> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> when<WH3588> I have sounded<WH2713> my father<WH1> about to morrow<WH4279> any time,<WH6256> or the third<WH7992> day, and, behold,<WH2009> if there be good<WH2896> toward<WH413> David,<WH1732> and I then<WH227> send<WH7971> not to you, and show<WH1540> it you;

And you shall not only while<WH518> yet<WH5750> I live<WH2416> show<WH6213> me the kindness<WH2617> of the LORD,<WH3068> that I die<WH4191> not:

But also you shall not cut<WH3772> off your kindness<WH2617> from my house<WH1004> for ever:<WH5769> no, not when the LORD<WH3068> has cut<WH3772> off the enemies<WH341> of David<WH1732> every<WH376> one<WH376> from the face<WH6440> of the earth.<WH127>

And when you have stayed three<WH8027> days, then you shall go<WH3381> down<WH3381> quickly,<WH3966> and come<WH935> to the place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> you did hide<WH5641> yourself when the business<WH4639> was in hand, and shall remain<WH3427> by the stone<WH68> Ezel.<WH237>
And I will shoot<WH3384> three<WH7969> arrows<WH2671> on the side<WH6654> thereof, as though I shot<WH7971> at a mark.<WH4307>

And, behold,<WH2009> I will send<WH7971> a lad,<WH5288> saying, Go,<WH3212> find<WH4672> out the arrows.<WH2671> If<WH518> I expressly<WH559> say<WH559> to the lad,<WH5288> Behold,<WH2009> the arrows<WH2671> are on this<WH2007> side of you, take<WH3947> them; then come<WH935> you: for there is peace<WH7965> to you, and no<WH369> hurt;<WH1697> as the LORD<WH3068> lives.<WH2416>

But if<WH518> I say<WH559> thus<WH3541> to the young<WH5958> man,<WH5958> Behold,<WH2009> the arrows<WH2671> are beyond<WH1973> you; go<WH3212> your way:<WH3212> for the LORD<WH3068> has sent<WH7971> you away.
And as touching the matter<WH1697> which<WH834> you and I have spoken<WH1696> of, behold,<WH2009> the LORD<WH3068> be between<WH996> you and me for ever.<WH5769>
So David<WH1732> hid<WH5641> himself in the field:<WH7704> and when the new<WH2320> moon<WH2320> was come,<WH1961> the king<WH4428> sat<WH3427> him down to eat<WH398> meat.<WH3899>

And the king<WH4428> sat<WH3427> on his seat,<WH4186> as at other times,<WH6471> even on a seat<WH4186> by the wall:<WH7023> and Jonathan<WH3083> arose,<WH6965> and Abner<WH74> sat<WH3427> by Saul's<WH7586> side,<WH6654> and David's<WH1732> place<WH4725> was empty.<WH6485>

Nevertheless Saul<WH7586> spoke<WH1696> not any<WH3972> thing that day:<WH3117> for he thought,<WH559> Something<WH4745> has befallen<WH4745> him, he is not clean;<WH2889> surely<WH3588> he is not clean.<WH2889>

And it came<WH1961> to pass on the morrow,<WH4283> which was the second<WH8145> day of the month,<WH2320> that David's<WH1732> place<WH4725> was empty:<WH6485> and Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to Jonathan<WH3083> his son,<WH1121> Why<WH4069> comes<WH935> not the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> to meat,<WH3899> neither<WH1571> yesterday,<WH8543> nor<WH1571> to day?<WH3117>
And Jonathan<WH3083> answered<WH6030> Saul,<WH7586> David<WH1732> earnestly asked<WH7592> leave of me to go to Bethlehem:<WH1035>

And he said,<WH559> Let me go,<WH7971> I pray<WH4994> you; for our family<WH4940> has a sacrifice<WH2077> in the city;<WH5892> and my brother,<WH251> he has commanded<WH6680> me to be there: and now,<WH6258> if<WH518> I have found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in your eyes,<WH5869> let me get<WH4422> away,<WH4422> I pray<WH4994> you, and see<WH7200> my brothers.<WH251> Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> he comes<WH935> not to the king's<WH4428> table.<WH7979>

Then Saul's<WH7586> anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against Jonathan,<WH3083> and he said<WH559> to him, You son<WH1121> of the perverse<WH5753> rebellious<WH4780> woman, do not I know<WH3045> that you have chosen<WH977> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> to your own confusion,<WH1322> and to the confusion<WH1322> of your mother's<WH517> nakedness?<WH6172>

For as long<WH3117> as the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> lives<WH2425> on the ground,<WH127> you shall not be established,<WH3559> nor your kingdom.<WH4438> Why now<WH6258> send<WH7971> and fetch<WH3947> him to me, for he shall surely die.<WH4191>
And Jonathan<WH3083> answered<WH6030> Saul<WH7586> his father,<WH1> and said<WH559> to him, Why<WH4100> shall he be slain?<WH4191> what<WH4100> has he done?<WH6213>

And Saul<WH7586> cast<WH2904> a javelin<WH2595> at<WH5921> him to smite<WH5221> him: whereby Jonathan<WH3083> knew<WH3045> that it was determined<WH3615> of his father<WH1> to slay<WH4191> David.<WH1732>

So Jonathan<WH3083> arose<WH6965> from the table<WH7979> in fierce<WH2750> anger,<WH639> and did eat<WH398> no<WH3808> meat<WH3899> the second<WH8145> day<WH3117> of the month:<WH2320> for he was grieved<WH6087> for David,<WH1732> because<WH3588> his father<WH1> had done him shame.<WH3637>
